alert.note: Alert for Appling; Bacon; Jeff Davis; Wayne (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 30 at 5:01PM EST by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Bacon, northwestern Wayne, southeastern Jeff Davis and Appling Counties through 545 PM EST... At 501 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a landspout near Graham, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts and wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Baxley, Graham, Surrency, Plant Hatch and Pine Grove. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. This type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
